original: 1 Mūlayamaka🔽1.1 Uddesa🔽1.1.1. Mūlavārauddesa🔽1.1.1.1. Kusalapada nayacatukka
analyzed: mūlayamaka  uddesa        kusala pada naya catukka
translated: Enumeration🔽... Enumeration of the Root Section🔽... The Four Pairs of the Wholesome Section

original: 1.1.1.1.1. Mūlanaya
analyzed: mūlanaya
translated: ... The Root Method

original: Namo tassa Bhagavato Arahato Sammāsambuddhassa.
analyzed: namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: Homage to that Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Rightly Self-awakened One.

original: Ye keci kusalā dhammā, sabbe te kusalamūlā?
analyzed: ye keci kusalāḥ dhammāḥ sabbe te kusala mūlā
translated: Are all wholesome phenomena rooted in wholesome roots?

original: Ye vā pana kusalamūlā, sabbe te dhammā kusalā?
analyzed: ye vā pana kusala mūlā sabbe te dhammā kusalā
translated: Or are all phenomena that are wholesome roots wholesome?

original: Ye keci kusalā dhammā, sabbe te kusalamūlena ekamūlā?
analyzed: ye keci kusalāḥ dhammāḥ sabbe te kusala mūlena eka mūlā
translated: Are all wholesome phenomena single-rooted with wholesome roots?

original: Ye vā pana kusalamūlena ekamūlā, sabbe te dhammā kusalā?
analyzed: ye vā pana kusala mūlena eka mūlā sabbe te dhammā kusalā
translated: Or are all phenomena that are single-rooted with wholesome roots wholesome?

original: Ye keci kusalamūlena ekamūlā dhammā, sabbe te kusalamūlena aññamaññamūlā?
analyzed: ye keci kusala mūlena eka mūlāḥ dhammāḥ sabbe te kusala mūlena aññamañña mūlā
translated: Are all phenomena that are single-rooted with wholesome roots mutually-rooted with wholesome roots?

original: Ye vā pana kusalamūlena aññamaññamūlā, sabbe te dhammā kusalā?
analyzed: ye vā pana kusala mūlena sabbe te dhammā kusalā
translated: Or are all phenomena that are mutually-rooted with wholesome roots wholesome?

original: 1.1.1.1.2. Mūlamūlanaya🔽Ye keci kusalā dhammā, sabbe te kusalamūlamūlā?🔽Ye vā pana kusalamūlamūlā, sabbe te dhammā kusalā?
analyzed: mūla mūla naya  ye keci kusalāḥ dhammāḥ sabbe te kusala mūla mūlā  ye vā pana kusala mūla mūlā sabbe te dhammā kusalā
translated: ... The Root of the Root Method🔽Are all wholesome phenomena rooted in the roots of wholesome roots?🔽Or are all phenomena that are rooted in the roots of wholesome roots wholesome?

original: Ye keci kusalā dhammā, sabbe te kusalamūlena ekamūlamūlā?
analyzed: ye keci kusalāḥ dhammāḥ sabbe te kusala mūlena eka mūla mūlā
translated: Are all wholesome phenomena single-rooted with the roots of wholesome roots?

original: Ye vā pana kusalamūlena ekamūlamūlā, sabbe te dhammā kusalā?🔽Ye keci kusalamūlena ekamūlamūlā dhammā, sabbe te kusalamūlena aññamaññamūlamūlā?
analyzed: ye vā pana kusala mūlena eka mūla mūlā sabbe te dhammā kusalā  ye keci kusala mūlena eka mūla mūlāḥ dhammāḥ sabbe te kusala mūlena aññamañña mūla mūlā
translated: Or are those things that have a wholesome root as their root all wholesome?🔽Are those things that have a wholesome root as their root all mutually having a wholesome root as their root?

original: Ye vā pana kusalamūlena aññamaññamūlamūlā, sabbe te dhammā kusalā?
analyzed: ye vā pana kusala mūlena sabbe te dhammā kusalā
translated: Or are those things that mutually have a wholesome root as their root all wholesome?

original: 1.1.1.1.3. Mūlakanaya
analyzed: mūlakanaya
translated: ... The method of roots

original: Ye keci kusalā dhammā, sabbe te kusalamūlakā?
analyzed: ye keci kusalāḥ dhammāḥ sabbe te kusala mūlakā
translated: Are those things that are wholesome all rooted in a wholesome root?

original: Ye vā pana kusalamūlakā, sabbe te dhammā kusalā?
analyzed: ye vā pana kusala mūlakā sabbe te dhammā kusalā
translated: Or are those things that are rooted in a wholesome root all wholesome?

original: Ye keci kusalā dhammā, sabbe te kusalamūlena ekamūlakā?
analyzed: ye keci kusalāḥ dhammāḥ sabbe te kusala mūlena eka mūlakā
translated: Are those things that are wholesome all having a wholesome root as their single root?

original: Ye vā pana kusalamūlena ekamūlakā, sabbe te dhammā kusalā?
analyzed: ye vā pana kusala mūlena eka mūlakā sabbe te dhammā kusalā
translated: Or are those things that have a wholesome root as their single root all wholesome?

original: Ye keci kusalamūlena ekamūlakā dhammā, sabbe te kusalamūlena aññamaññamūlakā?
analyzed: ye keci kusala mūlena eka mūlakā dhammā sabbe te kusala mūlena aññamañña mūlakā
translated: Are those things that have a wholesome root as their single root all mutually having a wholesome root as their root?

original: Ye vā pana kusalamūlena aññamaññamūlakā, sabbe te dhammā kusalā?
analyzed: ye vā pana kusala mūlena sabbe te dhammā kusalā
translated: Or are those things that mutually have a wholesome root as their root all wholesome?

original: 1.1.1.1.4. Mūlamūlakanaya
analyzed: mūla mūlaka naya
translated: ... The method of roots and root-roots

original: Ye keci kusalā dhammā, sabbe te kusalamūlamūlakā?
analyzed: ye keci kusalā dhammā sabbe te kusala mūla mūlakā
translated: Are those things that are wholesome all rooted in a wholesome root-root?

original: Ye vā pana kusalamūlamūlakā, sabbe te dhammā kusalā?
analyzed: ye vā pana kusala mūla mūlakā sabbe te dhammā kusalā
translated: Or are all those things that have a wholesome root wholesome?

original: Ye keci kusalā dhammā, sabbe te kusalamūlena ekamūlamūlakā?
analyzed: ye keci kusalā dhammā sabbe te kusala mūlena eka mūla mūlakā
translated: Are all wholesome things rooted in a wholesome root?

original: Ye vā pana kusalamūlena ekamūlamūlakā, sabbe te dhammā kusalā?
analyzed: ye vā pana kusala mūlena eka mūla mūlakā sabbe te dhammā kusalā
translated: Or are all those things that are rooted in a wholesome root wholesome?

original: Ye keci kusalamūlena ekamūlamūlakā dhammā, sabbe te kusalamūlena aññamaññamūlamūlakā?
analyzed: ye keci kusala mūlena eka mūla mūlakā dhammā sabbe te kusala mūlena aññamañña mūla mūlakā
translated: Are all things that are rooted in a wholesome root rooted in a wholesome root in mutual dependence?

original: Ye vā pana kusalamūlena aññamaññamūlamūlakā, sabbe te dhammā kusalā?
analyzed: ye vā pana kusala mūlena sabbe te dhammā kusalā
translated: Or are all those things that are rooted in a wholesome root in mutual dependence wholesome?

original: 1.1.1.2. Akusalapada nayacatukka
analyzed: akusala pada naya catukka
translated: ... The fourfold method of the unwholesome

original: 1.1.1.2.1. Mūlanaya🔽Ye keci akusalā dhammā, sabbe te akusalamūlā?
analyzed: mūlanaya  ye keci akusalā dhammā sabbe te akusala mūlā
translated: ... The method of the roots🔽Are all unwholesome things unwholesome roots?

original: Ye vā pana akusalamūlā, sabbe te dhammā akusalā?🔽Ye keci akusalā dhammā, sabbe te akusalamūlena ekamūlā?
analyzed: ye vā pana akusala mūlā sabbe te dhammā akusalā  ye keci akusalā dhammā sabbe te akusala mūlena eka mūlā
translated: Or are all those things that are unwholesome roots unwholesome?🔽Are all unwholesome things rooted in a wholesome root?

original: Ye vā pana akusalamūlena ekamūlā, sabbe te dhammā akusalā?🔽Ye keci akusalamūlena ekamūlā dhammā, sabbe te akusalamūlena aññamaññamūlā?
analyzed: ye vā pana akusala mūlena eka mūlā sabbe te dhammā akusalā 🔽ye keci akusala mūlena eka mūlāḥ dhammāḥ sabbe te akusala mūlena aññamañña mūlā
translated: Or are all those things that are rooted in a wholesome root unwholesome?🔽Are all things that are rooted in a wholesome root rooted in a wholesome root in mutual dependence?

original: Ye vā pana akusalamūlena aññamaññamūlā, sabbe te dhammā akusalā?
analyzed: ye vā pana akusala mūlena sabbe te dhammā akusalā
translated: Or are any unwholesome thoughts not rooted in the unwholesome roots?

original: 1.1.1.2.2. Mūlamūlanaya
analyzed: mūla mūla naya
translated: ..... The method of roots of roots

original: Ye keci akusalā dhammā, sabbe te akusalamūlamūlā?
analyzed: ye keci akusalā dhammā sabbe te akusala mūla mūlā
translated: Are any unwholesome thoughts rooted in the roots of the unwholesome roots?

original: Ye vā pana akusalamūlamūlā, sabbe te dhammā akusalā?
analyzed: ye vā pana akusala mūla mūlā sabbe te dhammā akusalā
translated: Or are any thoughts rooted in the roots of the unwholesome roots unwholesome?

original: Ye keci akusalā dhammā, sabbe te akusalamūlena ekamūlamūlā?
analyzed: ye keci akusalā dhammā sabbe te akusala mūlena eka mūla mūlā
translated: Are any unwholesome thoughts rooted in the unwholesome roots with the same root as themselves?

original: Ye vā pana akusalamūlena ekamūlamūlā, sabbe te dhammā akusalā?
analyzed: ye vā pana akusala mūlena eka mūla mūlā sabbe te dhammā akusalā
translated: Or are any thoughts rooted in the unwholesome roots with the same root as themselves unwholesome?

analyzed: ye keci akusala mūlena eka mūla mūlāḥ dhammāḥ sabbe te akusala mūlena aññamañña mūla mūlā
translated: Are any thoughts rooted in the unwholesome roots with the same root as themselves also rooted in the unwholesome roots with a different root from themselves?

original: Ye vā pana akusalamūlena aññamaññamūlamūlā, sabbe te dhammā akusalā?
analyzed: ye vā pana akusala mūlena sabbe te dhammā akusalā
translated: Or are any thoughts rooted in the unwholesome roots with a different root from themselves unwholesome?

original: 1.1.1.2.3. Mūlakanaya🔽Ye keci akusalā dhammā, sabbe te akusalamūlakā?
analyzed: mūlakanaya  ye keci akusalā dhammā sabbe te akusala mūlakā
translated: ..... The method of roots🔽Are any unwholesome thoughts rooted in the unwholesome roots?

original: Ye vā pana akusalamūlakā, sabbe te dhammā akusalā?
analyzed: ye vā pana akusala mūlakā sabbe te dhammā akusalā
translated: Or are any thoughts rooted in the unwholesome roots unwholesome?

original: Ye keci akusalā dhammā, sabbe te akusalamūlena ekamūlakā?
analyzed: ye keci akusalāḥ dhammāḥ sabbe te akusala mūlena eka mūlakā
translated: Are any unwholesome thoughts rooted in the unwholesome roots with the same root as themselves?

original: Ye vā pana akusalamūlena ekamūlakā, sabbe te dhammā akusalā?
analyzed: ye vā pana akusala mūlena eka mūlakā sabbe te dhammā akusalā
translated: Or are any thoughts rooted in the unwholesome roots with the same root as themselves unwholesome?

original: Ye keci akusalamūlena ekamūlakā dhammā, sabbe te akusalamūlena aññamaññamūlakā?
analyzed: ye keci akusala mūlena eka mūlakāḥ dhammāḥ sabbe te akusala mūlena aññamañña mūlakā

analyzed: ye vā pana akusala mūlena sabbe te dhammā akusalā

original: 1.1.1.2.4. Mūlamūlakanaya🔽Ye keci akusalā dhammā, sabbe te akusalamūlamūlakā?
analyzed: mūla mūlaka naya  ye keci akusalā dhammā sabbe te akusala mūla mūlakā
translated: The method of roots and root-roots🔽Are any of the unwholesome things rooted in a unwholesome root?

original: Ye vā pana akusalamūlamūlakā, sabbe te dhammā akusalā?🔽Ye keci akusalā dhammā, sabbe te akusalamūlena ekamūlamūlakā?
analyzed: ye vā pana akusala mūla mūlakā sabbe te dhammā akusalā  ye keci akusalā dhammā sabbe te akusala mūlena eka mūla mūlakā
translated: Or are any of the things rooted in a unwholesome root all unwholesome?🔽Are any of the unwholesome things all rooted in a unwholesome root?

original: Ye vā pana akusalamūlena ekamūlamūlakā, sabbe te dhammā akusalā?🔽Ye keci akusalamūlena ekamūlamūlakā dhammā, sabbe te akusalamūlena aññamaññamūlamūlakā?
analyzed: ye vā pana akusala mūlena eka mūla mūlakā sabbe te dhammā akusalā  ye keci akusala mūlena eka mūla mūlakāḥ dhammāḥ sabbe te akusala mūlena aññamañña mūla mūlakā
translated: Or are any of the things rooted in a unwholesome root all unwholesome?🔽Are any of the things rooted in a unwholesome root all rooted in one another’s roots?

original: Ye vā pana akusalamūlena aññamaññamūlamūlakā, sabbe te dhammā akusalā?
analyzed: ye vā pana akusala mūlena sabbe te dhammā akusalā
translated: Or are any of the things rooted in one another’s roots all unwholesome?

original: 1.1.1.3. Abyākatapada nayacatukka
analyzed: abyākata pada naya catukka
translated: The method of the fourfold method of the indeterminate

original: 1.1.1.3.1. Mūlanaya
analyzed: mūlanaya
translated: The method of roots

original: Ye keci abyākatā dhammā, sabbe te abyākatamūlā?
analyzed: ye keci abyākatāḥ dhammāḥ sabbe te abyākata mūlā
translated: Are any of the indeterminate things all rooted in an indeterminate root?

original: Ye vā pana abyākatamūlā, sabbe te dhammā abyākatā?🔽Ye keci abyākatā dhammā, sabbe te abyākatamūlena ekamūlā?🔽Ye vā pana abyākatamūlena ekamūlā, sabbe te dhammā abyākatā?🔽Ye keci abyākatamūlena ekamūlā dhammā, sabbe te abyākatamūlena aññamaññamūlā?

analyzed: ye vā pana abyākata mūlena aññamañña mūlā sabbe te dhammā abyākatā
translated: Are any of the ideas that are indeterminate by having an indeterminate root indeterminate by having a root that is other than indeterminate?

translated: ..... The method of roots of roots🔽Are any of the ideas that are indeterminate indeterminate by having a root of roots that is indeterminate?

original: Ye keci abyākatā dhammā, sabbe te abyākatamūlena ekamūlamūlā?
analyzed: ye keci abyākatā dhammā sabbe te abyākata mūlena eka mūla mūlā
translated: Are all the ideas that are indeterminate by having a root of roots that is indeterminate indeterminate?

analyzed: ye vā pana abyākata mūlena eka mūla mūlā sabbe te dhammā abyākatā

translated: Are any of the ideas that are indeterminate by having a root of roots that is indeterminate indeterminate by having a root of roots that is other than indeterminate?

analyzed: ye vā pana abyākata mūlena aññam añña mūla mūlā sabbe te dhammā abyākatā
translated: Or are any unwholesome and indeterminate phenomena rooted in unwholesome and indeterminate roots?

analyzed: mūlakanaya  ye keci abyākatāḥ dhammāḥ sabbe te abyākata mūlakā

original: Ye vā pana abyākatamūlakā, sabbe te dhammā abyākatā?🔽Ye keci abyākatā dhammā, sabbe te abyākatamūlena ekamūlakā?🔽Ye vā pana abyākatamūlena ekamūlakā, sabbe te dhammā abyākatā?

translated: Are any unwholesome phenomena rooted in unwholesome and indeterminate roots?🔽Or are any unwholesome phenomena rooted in wholesome, unwholesome and indeterminate roots?

analyzed: ye vā pana abyākata mūlena sabbe te dhammā abyākatā
translated: Are any unwholesome phenomena rooted in unwholesome and wholesome and indeterminate roots?

analyzed: mūla mūlaka naya  ye keci abyākatāḥ dhammāḥ sabbe te abyākata mūla mūlakā  ye vā pana abyākata mūla mūlakā sabbe te dhammā abyākatā
translated: ... The method of roots of roots🔽Are any unwholesome phenomena rooted in unwholesome roots of roots?🔽Or are any unwholesome phenomena rooted in wholesome and indeterminate roots of roots?

analyzed: ye keci abyākatā dhammā sabbe te abyākata mūlena eka mūla mūlakā

original: Ye vā pana abyākatamūlena ekamūlamūlakā, sabbe te dhammā abyākatā?🔽Ye keci abyākatamūlena ekamūlamūlakā dhammā, sabbe te abyākatamūlena aññamaññamūlamūlakā?
analyzed: ye vā pana abyākata mūlena eka mūla mūlakā sabbe te dhammā abyākatā  ye keci abyākata mūlena eka mūla mūlakāḥ dhammāḥ sabbe te abyākata mūlena aññamañña mūla mūlakā
translated: Or are all those things that have a single root with an indeterminate root indeterminate?🔽Are all those things that have a single root with an indeterminate root rooted in each other with an indeterminate root?

analyzed: ye vā pana abyākata mūlena sabbe te dhammā abyākatā

original: 1.1.1.4. Nāmapada nayacatukka
analyzed: nāma pada naya catukka
translated: ... The fourfold method of the terms

original: 1.1.1.3.1. Mūlanaya🔽Ye keci nāmā dhammā, sabbe te nāmamūlā?
analyzed: mūlanaya  ye keci nāmā dhammā sabbe te nāma mūlā

analyzed: ye vā pana nāma mūlena añña mañña mūlā sabbe te dhammā nāmā

original: Ye vā pana nāmamūlamūlā, sabbe te dhammā nāmā?

original: Ye keci nāmā dhammā, sabbe te nāmamūlena ekamūlamūlā?
analyzed: ye keci nāmā dhammā sabbe te nāma mūlena eka mūla mūlā
translated: Are any of the things called ‘name’ all rooted in the same root as name?

original: Ye vā pana nāmamūlena ekamūlamūlā, sabbe te dhammā nāmā?
analyzed: ye vā pana nāma mūlena eka mūla mūlā sabbe te dhammā nāmā
translated: Or are any of the things rooted in the same root as name all called ‘name’?

original: Ye keci nāmamūlena ekamūlamūlā dhammā, sabbe te nāmamūlena aññamaññamūlamūlā?
analyzed: ye keci nāma mūlena eka mūla mūlāḥ dhammāḥ sabbe te nāma mūlena añña mañña mūla mūlā
translated: Are any of the things rooted in the same root as name all rooted in one another as name?

original: Ye vā pana nāmamūlena aññamaññamūlamūlā, sabbe te dhammā nāmā?
analyzed: ye vā pana nāma mūlena añña mañña mūla mūlā sabbe te dhammā nāmā
translated: Or are any of the things rooted in one another as name all called ‘name’?

original: 1.1.1.3.3. Mūlakanaya🔽Ye keci nāmā dhammā, sabbe te nāmamūlakā?
analyzed: mūlakanaya  ye keci nāmā dhammā sabbe te nāma mūlakā
translated: … The method of roots🔽Are any of the things called ‘name’ all rooted in name?

original: Ye vā pana nāmamūlakā, sabbe te dhammā nāmā?
analyzed: ye vā pana nāma mūlakā sabbe te dhammā nāmā
translated: Or are any of the things rooted in name all called ‘name’?

original: Ye keci nāmā dhammā, sabbe te nāmamūlena ekamūlakā?
analyzed: ye keci nāmā dhammā sabbe te nāma mūlena eka mūlakā
translated: Are any of the things called ‘name’ all rooted in the same root as name?

original: Ye vā pana nāmamūlena ekamūlakā, sabbe te dhammā nāmā?
analyzed: ye vā pana nāma mūlena eka mūlakā sabbe te dhammā nāmā
translated: Or are any of the things rooted in the same root as name all called ‘name’?

original: Ye keci nāmamūlena ekamūlakā dhammā, sabbe te nāmamūlena aññamaññamūlakā?
analyzed: ye keci nāma mūlena eka mūlakāḥ dhammāḥ sabbe te nāma mūlena añña mañña mūlakā
translated: Are any of the things rooted in the same root as name all rooted in one another as name?

original: Ye vā pana nāmamūlena aññamaññamūlakā, sabbe te dhammā nāmā?
analyzed: ye vā pana nāma mūlena añña mañña mūlakā sabbe te dhammā nāmā
translated: Or are any of the things rooted in one another as name all called ‘name’?

original: 1.1.1.3.4. Mūlamūlakanaya
analyzed: mūla mūlaka naya
translated: … The method of roots and root-roots

original: Ye keci nāmā dhammā, sabbe te nāmamūlamūlakā?
analyzed: ye keci nāmā dhammā sabbe te nāma mūla mūlakā
translated: Are any of the things called ‘name’ all rooted in the root of name?

original: Ye vā pana nāmamūlamūlakā, sabbe te dhammā nāmā?🔽Ye keci nāmā dhammā, sabbe te nāmamūlena ekamūlamūlakā?🔽Ye vā pana nāmamūlena ekamūlamūlakā, sabbe te dhammā nāmā?🔽Ye keci nāmamūlena ekamūlamūlakā dhammā, sabbe te nāmamūlena aññamaññamūlamūlakā?
analyzed: ye vā pana nāma mūla mūlakā sabbe te dhammā nāmā  ye keci nāmā dhammā sabbe te nāma mūlena eka mūla mūlakā  ye vā pana nāma mūlena eka mūla mūlakā sabbe te dhammā nāmā  ye keci nāma mūlena eka mūla mūlakāḥ dhammāḥ sabbe te nāma mūlena aññam añña mūla mūlakā
translated: Or are any ideas that have a name as their root all names?🔽Or are any ideas that are names all rooted in the same root as name?🔽Or are any ideas that are rooted in the same root as name all names?🔽Or are any ideas that are rooted in the same root as name all rooted in mutual roots as name?

original: Ye vā pana nāmamūlena aññamaññamūlamūlakā, sabbe te dhammā nāmā?
analyzed: ye vā pana nāma mūlena añña mañña mūla mūlakā sabbe te dhammā nāmā
translated: Or are any ideas that are rooted in mutual roots as name all names?

original: Mūlavārauddeso.
analyzed: mūla vāra uddesaḥ
translated: The Enumeration of Roots is finished.
